zone.line: now you trifle with me as if my heart
were as whole in ^as yours, as if I were
not in truth a torn ^shorn lap ^lamb thrust out
on the bleak hill side, tortured by every
blast. I wished for no friend, no sympathy
I avoided you, you know I did, but
you forced yourself upon me and
gave me those wants which you
see with triump gives you power
over me. Oh the brave power of
the bitter North Wind which freezes
the tears it has caused to shed! But
I will not bear this; go: the ru sun
will rise and set as before you came,
and I will ^shall sit among the pines or
wander on the heath weeping and
complaining without wishing for you
to listen. You are cruel, very cruel, to
treat me who bleed at every pore in
this rough manner."
And then, when in answer
to my peevish words, I saw his counte
nance bent with living pity on me
